pageContext.description: Small fragment consisting of part of one side, part of two faces, and loop. Crushed out of [...] shape. Curved rib visible on one face; wood survives adhering to  [miner?] face.
pageContext.associations: Part of a large hoard; see card for first socketed celt.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX, 279,Jessup, Arch of Kent, 107,Evans,Journ. Anhtop. Inst. III, 230.
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hayne Wood, on limit of railway cutting, 6 ft. below surface, lying on stratum of sand, c. 25 yards NW by N of summit of hill.,FOund June 4, 1872
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
